newsitem.title: RWANDA: Rwandan government troops in Zaire city, diplomats.
newsitem.headline: Rwandan government troops in Zaire city, diplomats.

text.p: Rwandan government troops reached the centre of the eastern Zairean city of Goma on Friday, having landed by boat and crossed the land border, diplomats quoted witnesses as saying.

"There are RPA (Rwandan Patriotic Army) troops in uniforms in the centre of Goma city, the main square. They came in by land and across Lake Kivu on boats landing on the city beach," said a diplomat, who declined to be identified, quoting witnesses.
"We are 110 percent certain the RPA is in Goma. It is confirmed," added another diplomat.

Reuters correspondent Christian Jennings earlier reported two RPA gunboats offshore on Lake Kivu were firing into Goma after Rwandan and Zairean troops exchanged mortar and machinegun fire across the border.
Zaire accuses Rwanda, Burundi and Uganda of sending troops into eastern Zaire to wage war against the Zairean army.
Rwanda sent some soldiers into the eastern town of Bukavu earlier this week on an brief overnight incursion which an RPA officer said was aimed at stopping Zairean firing into Rwanda.
